sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe. Thank you for starting your day with us. Here's a look at Tuesday's top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says he could consider stopping his quest to join NATO

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: in exchange for a ceasefire and the withdrawal of Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow claims Ukrainian forces are using civilian locations as military facilities after targeting a shopping center in Kyiv that killed eight and in Kharkiv Ukraine's second largest city food is becoming even more scarce as those who haven't fled knuckle down to survive Vladimir Zelensky has said he's willing to consider Ukraine not seeking NATO membership in exchange for a ceasefire, the withdrawal of Russian troops and a guarantee of Ukraine's security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In a television interview, the Ukrainian president said any final peace deal would need to be validated by the Ukrainian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: VOLODYMYR ZELENSKYY, Ukrainian President-Elect, Ukraine When you talk about one or another change, you are not talking about the historical changes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I've told all the negotiating teams that when you talk about these changes, they may be historic. You come to a referendum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden, meanwhile, has reiterated fears that Russian President Vladimir Putin may resort to using chemical weapons in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin may resort to using chemical weapons in the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: He's already used chemical weapons in the past, and we should be careful about what's about to come. He knows there'll be severe consequences because of the United NATO front, but the point is, it's real. Biden's announced he will visit Poland this weekend. On Monday, Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki and Dutch leader Mark Rutte discussed strengthening sanctions on Russia, including a possible

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: blockade of all Russian ships to European ports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine peace talks are expected to resume today in a video conference format. Turkey's foreign minister said on Sunday that Russia and Ukraine were near an agreement on critical issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Reportedly, Turkey is in close contact with negotiators from both sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In an interview with Turkish daily Harriet, Mevlut Cavusoglu said, quote, we can say we are hopeful for a ceasefire if the sides do not take a step back from the current positions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But it is still not clear what exactly a possible agreement could be founded on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The head of Russia's negotiation team, Vladimir Medinsky, spoke on Friday about progress on two points.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's refusal to join nato and the country's neutrality however mihaila podolak advisor to the head of the ukrainian president's office responded on telegram saying that the statements by the russian side were only their requests and were aimed among other things as he said at at provoking tension in the media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mr Podolyak stressed that Ukraine's position in negotiations remains unchanged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ceasefire withdrawal of troops and strict security guarantees with concrete formulas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Galina Polonskaya, Euronews from Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This is aerial footage released by Russia's defense ministry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It says these images show the Ukrainian military using a Kiev shopping mall as an arms depot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That center was destroyed on Sunday, killing at least eight people. We would like to draw the attention of the Western media once again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We have presented absolute evidence of the criminal use by the Kyiv nationalist regime of civilian objects in residential areas and in other cities of Ukraine as firing positions for artillery and rocket systems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia says it struck the shopping centre with high precision, long-range weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Its defense ministry spokesman's claims could not be independently verified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia has been accused of targeting civilian areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This as Ukraine's state emergency services releases pictures of bomb disposal units removing unexploded shells from the city of Chernihiv, some 130 kilometers north of the capital. The city has been subjected to intense shelling since the start of the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After nearly a month of conflict the signs and sounds of war are everywhere in Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Once bustling streets are empty. Now it's just the mangled ruins that remain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Russian advance in the northeast is threatening Sumy, Chernihiv and Kharkiv. Each area is being shelled relentlessly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's impossible to think that just weeks ago this was a normal city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And as day breaks, hungry civilians queue for necessities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: These ladies were asked if they need humanitarian aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Of course we need it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: All the food shops are closed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Only one supermarket is open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There is an influx of people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is unaffordable there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Underground, the stations of the Kharkiv metro have quickly become thousands of people's homes as they flee the destruction above.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have been here since the 24th of February. Near our house, the school was on fire. Tanks were on fire. That's why we decided not to go back there. It is cold here. The children are getting sick. They get eye infections. They suffer from cold.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They cough, as you can hear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But even here, in an increasingly desperate situation, hope is not extinguished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A group of poets and musicians have performed underground, raising money for the war effort and raising people's spirits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile on the surface, authorities remain alert about possible threats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They think that this man is a Russian spy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the fog of war, everyone is unfortunately a suspect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kharkiv remains under Ukrainian control, but as it continues to be mercilessly pounded, no one knows how long it will be able to hold out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A caravan of 21 buses leaves Zaporozhye for the besieged city of Mariupol, where some 350,000 people have been trapped for almost a month without water and electricity. This convoy, led by the International Red Cross, intends to return with all the seats filled with local people. Meanwhile, fighting is already raging in the streets of Mariupol. In Kharkiv, some 300 kilometres to the north, hundreds of soldiers and volunteers are barricaded up in readiness to repel possible Russian incursions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At every trench and checkpoint there is fear and courage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: This Ukrainian officer narrowly escaped Russian shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: First, it was really scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It was deafening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The basement protected me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I can't describe my feelings in words. It was deafening. The basement protected me.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I can't describe my feelings in words. The fear for my family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite relentless shelling since the start of the invasion, Russia has not yet managed to completely encircle Kharkiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Authorities say at least five civilians have been killed in the latest round of attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Moscow wages another campaign aimed at domestic consumption, Russian soldiers deliver humanitarian aid to the residents of a town in the Kharkiv region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Around 300,000 people are surrounded in Mariupol, with no electricity, no running water and no heating.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Mykola Osichenko, the CEO of Mariupol TV, was in Mariupol when Russia invaded Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He managed to evacuate to Zaporozhye last Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: MYKOLA OSICHENKO, CEO, Mariupol TV People of my age barely ate anything and had very little water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Food and water were prioritized for children and the elderly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A family was evacuated from the left bank to our house, which is in the city center.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The left bank is where the heaviest fighting has been since the beginning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So this family, they stayed in the basement for five days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They couldn't leave because the fighting above didn't stop for the entire five days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A husband, wife and a six-month-old baby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They survived only because the mother managed to breastfeed the baby.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But the struggle is far from over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And last Wednesday, Ossishenko saw thousands of people attempting to leave the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Around 2,000 cars left the city that day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: There was a small child in almost every car.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: People were taking with them the most precious thing, and the most precious thing is not even your life, but the life of your child.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: So all these cars were driving the streets of the city, where very often there are dead bodies of the civilians killed. So all these cars were driving the streets of the city, where very often there are dead bodies of the civilians killed. And all these people were trying to distract their children somehow. Look at the sun, look at mummy and daddy, only so that the children don't look there, only so they don't see the bodies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As food and medical supplies become increasingly scarce, the scale of the humanitarian crisis in Mariupol can only get worse.
